text:
I’m currently experiencing some delays with workflows.
Basically we’re creating a deal on the first form submission, and then the user goes through a few other stages to add data to the deal and move it along a pipeline. But I’m getting an issue where I can see the workflow triggered instantly, but the create deal isn’t working until up to 4 mins later, this obviously means our process doesn’t work half the time. Does anyone know why the workflows happen so slowly?

it seems to be an if later on in the workflow that causes the start of the workflow to slow down, I don’t know if it’s because I used an if with 3 branches, but this is super annoying, I’ve just had to put the if bit in a seperate workflow as it’s not dependent on the first part and it seems to be working quicker, it still takes longer than i’d like to complete though
I just importaed like 2k blogs and it took half and hour

I had a conversation about this a while back, but does anyone have any good examples of resources sections/libraries they've built with HubSpot. I've seen the one example in the code library. Love if anybody has any others
<@UAR678CQN> - this should now be fixed! Apologies for any inconvenience.

hey beautiful people. I’m looking to track the CTAs on my site.

I’ve noticed that when you create a button under `Marketing > Lead Capture > CTAs` and copy the embed code, its actually an image. This concerns me for several reasons;

• I’m dynamically scaling all my fonts using RFS and an image won’t scale.
• Even if it did scale the size of the image it would appear blurry on high res displays who have an increased zoom
• I’ve already built a bunch of button modules and would like editors to be able to simply assign tracking to an existing module rather than scrapping it and embedding an image. 
Anyone have ideas on this?
is there a different way to track clicks perhaps?
Google tag manager is your best bet

Yep I’m aware of gtag manager however, considering we just moved to HubSpot I’d like to make use its feature set. Also if the event is logged by HubSpot we can then alter that lead’s data.

For example if they click to download a whitepaper on a specific topic we could then email them with more information
I’ve found this which might solve it. Still reading through <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/events/create-clicked-element-events>

In that case would be correct : event triggers on workflow <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/set-your-workflow-enrollment-triggers|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/set-your-workflow-enrollment-triggers>
thanks for the link! I’ll read over it

When you create a CTA, there’s two options, `Image Button` and `Custom Button`.

If you do `Custom Button` with `Button Style: Link (No Style)` you will be able to output whatever you’d like and still track clicks
